qas.question: Who discussed the idea of a collective effervescence?
What society was studied to describe the notion of collective effervescence?
Durkheim saw collective effervescence in what Australian aboriginal activity?
What is another term for collective effervescence?
Who didn't discuss the idea of a collective effervescence?
What society was studied to describe the notion of collective non-effervescence?
Durkheim saw collective effervescence in what Australian non-aboriginal activity?
What is another term for collective non-effervescence?

context: Sociological attention to emotion has varied over time. <a0_0><b4_0>Emilé Durkheim<b4_0/><a0_0/> (1915/1965) wrote about the collective effervescence or <a3_0>emotional energy<a3_0/> that was experienced by members of <a2_0><b6_0>totemic rituals<b6_0/><a2_0/> in <a1_0><b5_0>Australian aborigine society<b5_0/><a1_0/>. He explained how the heightened state of <b7_0>emotional energy<b7_0/> achieved during totemic rituals transported individuals above themselves giving them the sense that they were in the presence of a higher power, a force, that was embedded in the sacred objects that were worshipped. These feelings of exaltation, he argued, ultimately lead people to believe that there were forces that governed sacred objects.
